docs.snippet: Matt Kuchar and Gary Woodland began their week at The Barclays by going to Citi Field and getting a tour of the clubhouse, where Kuchar noticed an indoor batting cage and asked if they could try it out. He stood behind the net and threw to Woodlan...
docs.lead_paragraph: Matt Kuchar and Gary Woodland began their week at The Barclays by going to Citi Field and getting a tour of the clubhouse, where Kuchar noticed an indoor batting cage and asked if they could try it out. He stood behind the net and threw to Woodland, a promising baseball player in high school.

headline.main: Woodland, Kuchar Tied for Lead at Barclays
headline.print_headline: Woodland, Kuchar Tied for Lead at Barclays

docs.snippet: Clint Barmes hit a three-run home run, Charlie Morton pitched eight strong innings and the Pittsburgh Pirates beat the San Francisco Giants 3-1 on Friday night....

headline.main: Barmes' 3-Run Homer Leads Pirates to 3-1 Victory

docs.snippet: ESPN had been working with PBS on a film about head injuries in the National Football League, whose games are shown on the sports network and represent a cherished source of revenue....
docs.lead_paragraph: ESPN had been working with PBS on a film about head injuries in the National Football League, whose games are shown on the sports network and represent a cherished source of revenue.
docs.abstract: Pressure from NFL may have played role in ESPN's decision to withdraw from partnership with PBS in which it was producing documentary about league's contentious handling of concussions.

headline.main: N.F.L. Pressure Said to Lead ESPN to Quit Film Project
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Said to Have Pressured ESPN
